class Solution:
    def minFlips(self, grid: List[List[int]]) -> int:
        n, m = len(grid), len(grid[0])
        # if n==1:
        #     ct1 = 0
        #     for j in range(m):
        #         if(grid[0][j]==1):
        #             ct1 += 1
        #     if ct1 > m - m%4:
        #         return ct1 - (m-m%4)
        #     return min(ct1%4, 4-ct1%4)
        # if m==1:
        #     ct1 = 0
        #     for i in range(n):
        #         if(grid[i][0]==1):
        #             ct1 += 1
        #     if ct1 > n-n%4:
        #         return ct1 - (n - n%4)
        #     return min(ct1%4, 4-ct1%4)
        
        count = [0, 0, 0, 0, 0]
        for i in range(n//2):
            for j in range(m//2):
                ct = grid[i][j] + grid[n-1-i][j] + grid[i][m-1-j] + grid[n-1-i][m-1-j]
                count[ct] += 1
        
        ans = count[1] + 2*count[2] + count[3]
        print(ans)

        ct, ct1 = 0, 0
        if (n&1):
            for j in range(m//2):
                if grid[n//2][j] != grid[n//2][m-1-j]:
                    ct += 1
                elif grid[n//2][j] == 1:
                    ct1 += 1
        if (m&1):
            for i in range(n//2):
                if grid[i][m//2] != grid[n-1-i][m//2]:
                    ct += 1
                elif grid[i][m//2] == 1:
                    ct1 += 1
        ans += ct
        print(ct, ct1)
        if ct==0 and (ct1&1):
            ans += 2
        print(ans)

        if (n&1) and (m&1) and grid[n//2][m//2]==1:
            ans += 1

        return ans
